description: Clinical rules for Functional Medicine pattern recognition

rules.recommendation: Consider methylated B-vitamin supplementation (L-Methylfolate 400-800mcg, Methylcobalamin 1000mcg) to support methylation and reduce homocysteine.
Suboptimal ferritin (<50) is associated with fatigue even when not frankly anemic. Consider iron supplementation with Vitamin C for absorption.
Vitamin D insufficiency detected. Consider supplementation with Vitamin D3 2000-5000 IU daily with fat-containing meal. Recheck in 8-12 weeks.
TSH above optimal range (>2.5) with normal T4 may indicate subclinical hypothyroidism. Consider symptoms, antibodies (TPO), and trial of thyroid support.
Elevated inflammatory markers detected. Investigate source of inflammation. Consider anti-inflammatory diet, omega-3 supplementation, and addressing gut health.
Pattern consistent with insulin resistance/prediabetes. Consider lifestyle intervention (low-glycemic diet, exercise), berberine, or metformin.
Suboptimal B12 (<400) may cause neurological symptoms. Consider methylcobalamin supplementation, especially if on metformin or PPI.
Omega-3 index below optimal (<8%). Associated with increased cardiovascular risk and inflammation. Consider high-quality fish oil 2-4g EPA+DHA daily.
APOE4 carrier status increases cardiovascular and Alzheimer's risk. Prioritize Mediterranean diet, exercise, sleep optimization, and aggressive lipid management.
Poor CYP2D6 metabolizer. Avoid codeine/tramadol (no efficacy). Reduce doses of many antidepressants. Check interactions before prescribing.
Elevated zonulin suggests increased intestinal permeability. Consider elimination diet, L-glutamine, and addressing underlying triggers (gluten, stress, dysbiosis).
Low morning cortisol may indicate HPA axis dysfunction. Consider adaptogenic herbs (ashwagandha, rhodiola), stress management, and sleep optimization.
